content.title: IVC Tumor Thrombus Management
content.definition: Surgical management of inferior vena cava tumor thrombus, most commonly from renal cell carcinoma, requiring en bloc tumor removal with vascular control and reconstruction.

key_concepts.description: Level I: Thrombus in renal vein only. Level II: Infraheaptic IVC. Level III: Intrahepatic/retrohepatic IVC. Level IV: Supradiaphragmatic/intracardiac.
Renal cell carcinoma (most common), adrenocortical carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, Wilms tumor, leiomyosarcoma
Key distinction: bland thrombus extends into lumen vs tumor invading IVC wall requiring resection

level_I_II.vascular_control: Infrarenal IVC, contralateral renal vein, suprarenal IVC below hepatic veins
level_I_II.technique: Cavotomy, thrombus extraction, primary repair of IVC

level_III.approach: Thoracoabdominal or abdominal with liver mobilization
level_III.vascular_control: May require total hepatic vascular exclusion (Pringle + suprahepatic IVC control)
level_III.liver_mobilization: Complete mobilization with division of short hepatic veins

level_IV.vascular_control: CPB with hypothermic circulatory arrest for atrial thrombus
level_IV.team: Cardiac surgery, vascular surgery, urologic oncology

ivc_reconstruction.patch_venoplasty: Bovine pericardium or PTFE for partial wall resection
ivc_reconstruction.interposition_graft: PTFE or ringed PTFE for segmental resection
ivc_reconstruction.ligation: Acceptable if collaterals developed and infrarenal IVC only

postoperative: Renal failure (if contralateral renal vein compromised)

outcomes.mortality: Level I-II: 2-5%, Level III: 5-10%, Level IV: 10-20%
outcomes.5_year_survival: 40-65% for RCC with tumor thrombus if no distant metastases
outcomes.factors_affecting_survival: Nodal status, distant metastases, IVC wall invasion

content.statement: IVC Tumor Thrombus Management is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Oncovascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding IVC Tumor Thrombus Management helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of IVC Tumor Thrombus Management include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of IVC Tumor Thrombus Management.

citations: Blute ML, et al. The Mayo Clinic experience with surgical management of vena caval tumor thrombus. J Urol. 2004;172:859-864
Ciancio G, Soloway MS. Surgical management of renal cell carcinoma with tumor thrombus. J Urol. 2002;168:1581-1590

learning_objectives: Classify IVC tumor thrombus by level using Neves/Zincke system
Describe surgical approach for each level of tumor thrombus
Explain options for IVC reconstruction after tumor thrombectomy
Discuss multidisciplinary team requirements for complex cases
clinical_pearls: MRI/MRV best defines thrombus extent and wall invasion
Always assess for pulmonary embolism preoperatively
IVC filter contraindicated - tumor thrombus is not bland thrombus
Level IV requires cardiac surgery collaboration and CPB capability
